title: Wrap app with LanguageProvider to prevent useLanguage runtime crash

requirements.summary: Wrap the routed React tree in LanguageProvider so useLanguage() in App.tsx (IndexComponent) and AppLayout is always inside provider context.
acceptanceCriteria: Loading any route (including `/`) no longer throws the error "useLanguage must be used within a LanguageProvider" in the browser console.
`useLanguage()` works in `IndexComponent` (home page) and `AppLayout` (header language selector + translated nav/footer) without crashing.
The app renders successfully without requiring changes to immutable provider bootstrap files (e.g., `frontend/src/main.tsx`).

file_operations.description: Import `LanguageProvider` from `frontend/src/i18n/LanguageProvider.tsx` and wrap the existing app tree (currently wrapped by `ThemeProvider`) so that `RouterProvider` (and therefore all routes/layouts, including `IndexComponent` and `AppLayout`) render within `LanguageProvider` context, eliminating the runtime error.
